text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Game Boy Advance is a portable handheld console created by Nintendo in 2001. Featuring a 32-bit processor clocked at 16MHz, an 8MHz GPU, 380KB of RAM and a display of 240x160 in 511 colors, it was the most powerful handhald console for its time. In 2003, Nintendo would release the GBA SP, a clamshell version featuring a backlit screen, a rechargeable lithium battery and a reduced overall size. It would then be followed up by the Game Boy Micro, an even smaller version.
